intro: Bunchosia holosericea, commonly known as the silky bush, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Bunchosia holosericea is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
